title: Case Study: Myotonic Dystrophy in a 35-Year-Old Male
clinical_history: A 35-year-old male, John, presented with complaints of progressive muscle stiffness and wasting, particularly in the distal muscles of his arms and legs. He reported difficulty releasing his grip after shaking hands or holding objects, and experienced myotonia, characterized by delayed relaxation of muscles after contraction. He also complained of fatigue, muscle weakness, and difficulty swallowing. John's symptoms have been worsening over the past 5 years, with a significant impact on his daily activities and quality of life.

nprs.affected_area: Muscle stiffness and myotonia in hands and feet
Muscle weakness in arms and legs

aggrevating_factors: Cold temperatures, stress, and prolonged periods of rest
picture: A 24-hour picture of John's daily activities, showing his difficulties with muscle stiffness and weakness, particularly in the morning and after periods of rest.
easing_factors: Warm temperatures, gentle exercise, and muscle heat
past_history: Family history of myotonic dystrophy; his mother and grandmother were affected
medical_history: Mild cognitive impairment, cataracts, and hypogonadism
medications: Medications to manage symptoms, such as mexiletine for myotonia and pain management
personal_history: Married with two children; works as an accountant, but has had to reduce his work hours due to his condition
imaging: EMG and muscle biopsy results showing myopathic changes and myotonia
